segment.source: Prepare for Zero Touch Installation of Windows 10 with Configuration Manager (Windows 10)
segment.target: Prepare for Zero Touch Installation of Windows 10 with Configuration Manager (Windows 10)

segment.source: This topic will walk you through the process of integrating Microsoft System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager SP1 with Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT) 2013 Update 2, as well as the other preparations needed to deploying Windows 10 via Zero Touch Installation.
segment.target: This topic will walk you through the process of integrating Microsoft System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager SP1 with Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT) 2013 Update 2, as well as the other preparations needed to deploying Windows 10 via Zero Touch Installation.

segment.source: Additional preparations include the installation of hotfixes as well as activities that speed up the Pre-Boot Execution Environment (PXE).
segment.target: Additional preparations include the installation of hotfixes as well as activities that speed up the Pre-Boot Execution Environment (PXE).

segment.source: Prepare for Zero Touch Installation of Windows 10 with Configuration Manager
segment.target: Prepare for Zero Touch Installation of Windows 10 with Configuration Manager

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: This topic will walk you through the process of integrating Microsoft System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager SP1 with Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT) 2013 Update 2, as well as the other preparations needed to deploying Windows 10 via Zero Touch Installation.
segment.target: This topic will walk you through the process of integrating Microsoft System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager SP1 with Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT) 2013 Update 2, as well as the other preparations needed to deploying Windows 10 via Zero Touch Installation.

segment.source: Additional preparations include the installation of hotfixes as well as activities that speed up the Pre-Boot Execution Environment (PXE).
segment.target: Additional preparations include the installation of hotfixes as well as activities that speed up the Pre-Boot Execution Environment (PXE).

segment.source: Prerequisites
segment.target: Prerequisites

segment.source: In this topic, you will use an existing Configuration Manager server structure to prepare for operating system deployment.
segment.target: In this topic, you will use an existing Configuration Manager server structure to prepare for operating system deployment.

segment.source: In addition to the base setup, the following configurations should be made in the Configuration Manager environment:
segment.target: In addition to the base setup, the following configurations should be made in the Configuration Manager environment:

segment.source: Active Directory Schema has been extended and System Management container created.
segment.target: Active Directory Schema has been extended and System Management container created.

segment.source: Active Directory Forest Discovery and Active Directory System Discovery have been enabled.
segment.target: Active Directory Forest Discovery and Active Directory System Discovery have been enabled.

segment.source: IP range boundaries and a boundary group for content and site assignment have been created.
segment.target: IP range boundaries and a boundary group for content and site assignment have been created.

segment.source: The Configuration Manager reporting services point role has been added and configured
segment.target: The Configuration Manager reporting services point role has been added and configured

segment.source: A file system folder structure for packages has been created.
segment.target: A file system folder structure for packages has been created.

segment.source: A Configuration Manager console folder structure for packages has been created.
segment.target: A Configuration Manager console folder structure for packages has been created.

segment.source: System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager SP1 and any additional Windows 10 prerequisites are installed.
segment.target: System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager SP1 and any additional Windows 10 prerequisites are installed.

segment.source: For the purposes of this topic, we will use two machines: DC01 and CM01.
segment.target: For the purposes of this topic, we will use two machines: DC01 and CM01.

segment.source: DC01 is a domain controller and CM01 is a machine running Windows Server 2012 R2 Standard.
segment.target: DC01 is a domain controller and CM01 is a machine running Windows Server 2012 R2 Standard.

segment.source: DC01 and CM01 are both members of the domain contoso.com for the fictitious Contoso Corporation.
segment.target: DC01 and CM01 are both members of the domain contoso.com for the fictitious Contoso Corporation.

segment.source: For more details on the setup for this topic, please see Deploy Windows 10 with the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit.
segment.target: For more details on the setup for this topic, please see Deploy Windows 10 with the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit.

segment.source: Create the Configuration Manager service accounts
segment.target: Create the Configuration Manager service accounts

segment.source: To configure permissions for the various service accounts needed for operating system deployment in Configuration Manager, you use a role-based model.
segment.target: To configure permissions for the various service accounts needed for operating system deployment in Configuration Manager, you use a role-based model.

segment.source: To create the Configuration Manager Join Domain account as well as the Configuration Manager Network Access account, follow these steps:
segment.target: To create the Configuration Manager Join Domain account as well as the Configuration Manager Network Access account, follow these steps:

segment.source: On DC01, using Active Directory User and Computers, browse to contoso.com / Contoso / Service Accounts.
segment.target: On DC01, using Active Directory User and Computers, browse to contoso.com / Contoso / Service Accounts.

segment.source: Select the Service Accounts OU and create the CMJD account using the following settings:
segment.target: Select the Service Accounts OU and create the CMJD account using the following settings:

segment.source: Name: CMJD
segment.target: Name: CMJD

segment.source: User logon name: CMJD
segment.target: User logon name: CMJD

segment.source: Password: P@ssw0rd
segment.target: Password: P@ssw0rd

segment.source: User must change password at next logon: Clear
segment.target: User must change password at next logon: Clear

segment.source: User cannot change password: Select
segment.target: User cannot change password: Select

segment.source: Password never expires: Select
segment.target: Password never expires: Select

segment.source: Repeat the step, but for the CMNAA account.
segment.target: Repeat the step, but for the CMNAA account.

segment.source: After creating the accounts, assign the following descriptions:
segment.target: After creating the accounts, assign the following descriptions:

segment.source: CMJD: Configuration Manager Join Domain Account
segment.target: CMJD: Configuration Manager Join Domain Account

segment.source: CMNAA: Configuration Manager Network Access Account
segment.target: CMNAA: Configuration Manager Network Access Account

segment.source: figure 6
segment.target: figure 6

segment.source: Figure 6.
segment.target: Figure 6.

segment.source: The Configuration Manager service accounts used for operating system deployment.
segment.target: The Configuration Manager service accounts used for operating system deployment.

segment.source: Configure Active Directory permissions
segment.target: Configure Active Directory permissions

segment.source: In order for the Configuration Manager Join Domain Account (CMJD) to join machines into the contoso.com domain you need to configure permissions in Active Directory.
segment.target: In order for the Configuration Manager Join Domain Account (CMJD) to join machines into the contoso.com domain you need to configure permissions in Active Directory.

segment.source: These steps assume you have downloaded the sample Set-OUPermissions.ps1 script and copied it to C:SetupScripts on DC01.
segment.target: These steps assume you have downloaded the sample Set-OUPermissions.ps1 script and copied it to C:SetupScripts on DC01.

segment.source: On DC01, log on as Administrator in the CONTOSO domain using the password P@ssw0rd.
segment.target: On DC01, log on as Administrator in the CONTOSO domain using the password P@ssw0rd.

segment.source: In an elevated Windows PowerShell prompt (run as Administrator), run the following commands, pressing Enter after each command:
segment.target: In an elevated Windows PowerShell prompt (run as Administrator), run the following commands, pressing Enter after each command:

segment.source: The Set-OUPermissions.ps1 script allows the CMJD user account permissions to manage computer accounts in the Contoso / Computers / Workstations OU.
segment.target: The Set-OUPermissions.ps1 script allows the CMJD user account permissions to manage computer accounts in the Contoso / Computers / Workstations OU.

segment.source: The following is a list of the permissions being granted:
segment.target: The following is a list of the permissions being granted:

segment.source: Scope: This object and all descendant objects
segment.target: Scope: This object and all descendant objects

segment.target: Create Computer objects

segment.target: Delete Computer objects

segment.target: Scope: Descendant Computer objects

segment.target: Read All Properties

segment.target: Write All Properties

segment.source: Read Permissions
segment.target: Read Permissions

segment.source: Modify Permissions
segment.target: Modify Permissions

segment.source: Change Password
segment.target: Change Password

segment.source: Reset Password
segment.target: Reset Password

segment.source: Validated write to DNS host name
segment.target: Validated write to DNS host name

segment.source: Validated write to service principal name
segment.target: Validated write to service principal name

segment.source: Review the Sources folder structure
segment.target: Review the Sources folder structure

segment.source: To support the packages you create in this section, the following folder structure should be created on the Configuration Manager primary site server (CM01):
segment.target: To support the packages you create in this section, the following folder structure should be created on the Configuration Manager primary site server (CM01):

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: In most production environments, the packages are stored on a Distributed File System (DFS) share or a "normal" server share, but in a lab environment you can store them on the site server.
segment.target: In most production environments, the packages are stored on a Distributed File System (DFS) share or a "normal" server share, but in a lab environment you can store them on the site server.

segment.source: Integrate Configuration Manager with MDT
segment.target: Integrate Configuration Manager with MDT

segment.source: To extend the Configuration Manager console with MDT 2013 Update 2 wizards and templates, you install MDT 2013 Update 2 in the default location and run the integration setup.
segment.target: To extend the Configuration Manager console with MDT 2013 Update 2 wizards and templates, you install MDT 2013 Update 2 in the default location and run the integration setup.

segment.source: In these steps, we assume you have downloaded MDT 2013 Update 2 to the C:SetupMDT2013 folder on CM01.
segment.target: In these steps, we assume you have downloaded MDT 2013 Update 2 to the C:SetupMDT2013 folder on CM01.

segment.source: On CM01, log on as Administrator in the CONTOSO domain using the password P@ssw0rd.
segment.target: On CM01, log on as Administrator in the CONTOSO domain using the password P@ssw0rd.

segment.source: Make sure the Configuration Manager Console is closed before continuing.
segment.target: Make sure the Configuration Manager Console is closed before continuing.

segment.source: Using File Explorer, navigate to the C:SetupMDT 2013 folder.
segment.target: Using File Explorer, navigate to the C:SetupMDT 2013 folder.

segment.source: Run the MDT 2013 setup (MicrosoftDeploymentToolkit2013x64.msi), and use the default options in the setup wizard.
segment.target: Run the MDT 2013 setup (MicrosoftDeploymentToolkit2013x64.msi), and use the default options in the setup wizard.

segment.source: From the Start screen, run Configure ConfigManager Integration with the following settings:
segment.target: From the Start screen, run Configure ConfigManager Integration with the following settings:

segment.source: Site Server Name: CM01.contoso.com
segment.target: Site Server Name: CM01.contoso.com

segment.source: Site code: PS1
segment.target: Site code: PS1

segment.source: figure 8
segment.target: figure 8

segment.source: Figure 8.
segment.target: Figure 8.

segment.source: Set up the MDT 2013 Update 2 integration with Configuration Manager.
segment.target: Set up the MDT 2013 Update 2 integration with Configuration Manager.

segment.source: Configure the client settings
segment.target: Configure the client settings

segment.source: Most organizations want to display their name during deployment.
segment.target: Most organizations want to display their name during deployment.

segment.source: In this section, you configure the default Configuration Manager client settings with the Contoso organization name.
segment.target: In this section, you configure the default Configuration Manager client settings with the Contoso organization name.

segment.source: On CM01, using the Configuration Manager Console, in the Administration workspace, select Client Settings.
segment.target: On CM01, using the Configuration Manager Console, in the Administration workspace, select Client Settings.

segment.source: In the right pane, right-click Default Client Settings, and select Properties.
segment.target: In the right pane, right-click Default Client Settings, and select Properties.

segment.source: In the Computer Agent node, in the Organization name displayed in Software Center text box, type in Contoso and click OK.
segment.target: In the Computer Agent node, in the Organization name displayed in Software Center text box, type in Contoso and click OK.

segment.source: figure 9
segment.target: figure 9

segment.source: Figure 9.
segment.target: Figure 9.

segment.source: Configure the organization name in client settings.
segment.target: Configure the organization name in client settings.

segment.source: figure 10
segment.target: figure 10

segment.source: Figure 10.
segment.target: Figure 10.

segment.source: The Contoso organization name displayed during deployment.
segment.target: The Contoso organization name displayed during deployment.

segment.source: Configure the Network Access account
segment.target: Configure the Network Access account

segment.source: Configuration Manager uses the Network Access account during the Windows 10 deployment process to access content on the distribution point(s).
segment.target: Configuration Manager uses the Network Access account during the Windows 10 deployment process to access content on the distribution point(s).

segment.source: In this section, you configure the Network Access account.
segment.target: In this section, you configure the Network Access account.

segment.source: Using the Configuration Manager Console, in the Administration workspace, expand Site Configuration and select Sites.
segment.target: Using the Configuration Manager Console, in the Administration workspace, expand Site Configuration and select Sites.

segment.source: Right-click PS1 - Primary Site 1, select Configure Site Components, and then select Software Distribution.
segment.target: Right-click PS1 - Primary Site 1, select Configure Site Components, and then select Software Distribution.

segment.source: In the Network Access Account tab, configure the CONTOSOCMNAA user account (select New Account) as the Network Access account.
segment.target: In the Network Access Account tab, configure the CONTOSOCMNAA user account (select New Account) as the Network Access account.

segment.source: Use the new Verify option to verify that the account can connect to the DC01sysvol network share.
segment.target: Use the new Verify option to verify that the account can connect to the DC01sysvol network share.

segment.source: figure 11
segment.target: figure 11

segment.source: Figure 11.
segment.target: Figure 11.

segment.source: Test the connection for the Network Access account.
segment.target: Test the connection for the Network Access account.

segment.source: Enable PXE on the CM01 distribution point
segment.target: Enable PXE on the CM01 distribution point

segment.source: Configuration Manager has many options for starting a deployment, but starting via PXE is certainly the most flexible in a large environment.
segment.target: Configuration Manager has many options for starting a deployment, but starting via PXE is certainly the most flexible in a large environment.

segment.source: In this section, you enable PXE on the CM01 distribution point.
segment.target: In this section, you enable PXE on the CM01 distribution point.

segment.source: In the Configuration Manager Console, in the Administration workspace, select Distribution Points.
segment.target: In the Configuration Manager Console, in the Administration workspace, select Distribution Points.

segment.source: Right-click the CM01.CONTOSO.COM distribution point and select Properties.
segment.target: Right-click the CM01.CONTOSO.COM distribution point and select Properties.

segment.source: In the PXE tab, select the following settings:
segment.target: In the PXE tab, select the following settings:

segment.source: Enable PXE support for clients
segment.target: Enable PXE support for clients

segment.source: Allow this distribution point to respond to incoming PXE requests
segment.target: Allow this distribution point to respond to incoming PXE requests

segment.source: Enable unknown computer support
segment.target: Enable unknown computer support

segment.source: Require a password when computers use PXE
segment.target: Require a password when computers use PXE

segment.source: Password and Confirm password: Passw0rd!
segment.target: Password and Confirm password: Passw0rd!

segment.source: figure 12
segment.target: figure 12

segment.source: Figure 12.
segment.target: Figure 12.

segment.source: Configure the CM01 distribution point for PXE.
segment.target: Configure the CM01 distribution point for PXE.

segment.source: Using the Configuration Manager Trace Log Tool, review the E:Program FilesMicrosoft Configuration ManagerLogsdistmgr.log file.
segment.target: Using the Configuration Manager Trace Log Tool, review the E:Program FilesMicrosoft Configuration ManagerLogsdistmgr.log file.

segment.source: Look for ConfigurePXE and CcmInstallPXE lines.
segment.target: Look for ConfigurePXE and CcmInstallPXE lines.

segment.source: figure 13
segment.target: figure 13

segment.source: Figure 13.
segment.target: Figure 13.

segment.source: The distmgr.log displays a successful configuration of PXE on the distribution point.
segment.target: The distmgr.log displays a successful configuration of PXE on the distribution point.

segment.source: Verify that you have seven files in each of the folders E:RemoteInstallSMSBootx86 and E:RemoteInstallSMSBootx64.
segment.target: Verify that you have seven files in each of the folders E:RemoteInstallSMSBootx86 and E:RemoteInstallSMSBootx64.

segment.source: figure 14
segment.target: figure 14

segment.source: Figure 14.
segment.target: Figure 14.

segment.source: The contents of the E:RemoteInstallSMSBootx64 folder after you enable PXE.
segment.target: The contents of the E:RemoteInstallSMSBootx64 folder after you enable PXE.
